body:
Hi.

Im investigating reflected light of sun from glazing of buildings with "Honeybee_Run Daylight Simulation" component.



Radiance materials can be set reflectance of each RGB.

Then, can I define reflectance of near infrared(NIR, unvisible light) of solar radiation?



Is the NIR reflectance equal to RGB reflectance?



I apologize for my poor English.

Thank you.
topic: How to define reflectance of near infrared of solar radiation

replies.body:
Hi Natchan,

I don't know the answer to this question and actually I'm very interested to know the answer. I sent a similar question to Radiance group while ago ([http://permalink.gmane.org/gmane.comp.graphics.radiance.general/4587](http://permalink.gmane.org/gmane.comp.graphics.radiance.general/4587)), and I haven't heard back. Maybe you want to send your question to the group too (radiance-general@radiance-online.org).

Mostapha

Hi, Mostapha.



I will try to ask radiance-general@radiance-online.org the question.

 

Thank you for your reply.

Hi all, 

I am currently doing a program to calculate the solar factor of a façade which take into account visible and infrared radiations. That's why I'm interested in the discussion... Did you have a response from Radiance group ?

Thanks

Severine
